Home Security Tips

  • Arm your system with no-delay at night. The alarm will automatically sound causing an immediate response to an unexpected intrusion.
  • Home care and lawn maintenance can show that one takes care of their home. Homes that are nicely taken care of can deter a burglar from intruding.
  • Test your home security system monthly. This will ensure connectivity and to make sure your system is always working properly.

Extreme Weather Security Tips

  • Place flood sensors strategically in the basement, low areas of the home, or near water pipes to detect early stages of unexpected flooding.
  • Get freeze sensors to place in different parts of the home that may not be insulated well. Place in rooms you want to keep a closer eye on.
  • Place a smoke detector on all levels of the home. A fire can be a total loss, but detecting a fire early can prevent that.
  • Early detection of unexpected extreme weather can really make a difference. Detect extreme weather in its early stages and protect your home with Alarm Zone.

Vacation Security Tips

  • When leaving your home alone, arm your system for no delay. With the alarm sounding immediately when triggered, this will give no time for burglars to actually invade your home.
  • Get interactive home security to keep a closer eye on your home. With interactive home security, you can monitor your home while on the go. Get text or email notification on your mobile of alarms or events that happen with your alarm system.
